creditline: Gift of Kaywin Feldman in honor of Casey Riley
inscription: on verso, written in cursive, black ink, at top of mount: This Indian is now 109 years old and he resides near St. Paul | on recto printed in black ink, below title: Chief of Gull Lake Chippewas. Who to escape the vengeance of the Indians when they discovered his friendship for the whites, in the outbreak of 1862, was obliged to seek protection in Fort Ripley. | on recto, printed in black ink, below title | on recto, at bottom, printed in black ink: WHITNEY’S GALLERY, SAINT PAUL.
signed: on recto, printed in black ink, below image: QUI-WI-SAIN-SISH, (BAD BOY.)
title: Qui-Wi-Sain-Sish, (Bad Boy.)
